newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: PBL says takes A$45 mln Optus notes.
newsitem.headline: PBL says takes A$45 mln Optus notes.

text.p: Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd (PBL) confirmed on Tuesday its subsidiary Pay TV Holdings Ltd (PTH) had agreed to transfer its shares in Optus Vision for a A$45 million convertible notes in Optus Communications.
The note would be convertible, subject to conditions, into 30 million Optus Communications shares at A$1.50, PBL said. The agreement is expected to be completed within the next month.
PBL said it did not expect to book a material loss or gain as a result of the transaction.
PBL said Pay TV Holdings would retain its interests in Optus Vision affilates Sports Vision and Movie Vision.
The agreement was part of a complicated deal reached by telecommunications carrier Optus Communications to acquire 100 percent of pay television and telephony company Optus Vision.

Shareholders in Optus Vision were Optus Communications and Continental Cablevision Inc, owned by American telephone concern US West Inc, with 46.5 percent each, Kerry Packer's PBL at five percent and the Kerry Stokes-controlled Seven Network Ltd at two percent.
